Name: Jonathan Day
Job Title: Permanent Secretary, Chairman of the JIC and Professional Head of Intelligence Analysis
Job/Team Function: To chair the Joint Intelligence Committee and to oversee the work of the Assessments Staff so as to ensure effective support for the Prime Minister and the National Security Council through provision of timely, accurate and objective all-source intelligence assessments. To oversee the work of the intelligence analytical community across government, so as to ensure the development of necessary capabilities and skills.

Name: Stephen Kelly
Job Title: Chief Operating Officer, Efficiency and Reform
Job/Team Function: The Chief Operating Officer, UK Government's role is to support the Minister for the Cabinet Office and the Chief Secretary to the Treasury to implement the Government's Efficiency and Reform agenda by driving major changes in the way the business of government operates.

Name: Tom Scholar
Job Title: Permanent Secretary, Prime Minister's Adviser, Head of the European and Global Secretariat
Job/Team Function: EGIS is responsible for coordinating the work of Government in reaching collective agreement on International Economic (including G20/G8, international trade and development issues) and European policy and to provide advice on these matters to the Prime Minister, Deputy Prime Minister, and the Cabinet Office Minister for Government Policy
Notes: Team 5 or fewer: team costs included at Post Ref 121

Name: Kim Darroch
Job Title: Permanent Secretary, Prime Minister's National Security Adviser
Job/Team Function: Principal adviser to the Prime Minister, Deputy Prime Minister and the National Security Council across all national security issues.

Name: Richard Heaton CB
Job Title: Permanent Secretary of the Cabinet Office and First Parliamentary Counsel
Job/Team Function: Richard has a dual role. Richard Heaton is Permanent Secretary for the Cabinet Office with responsibility for the leadership and governance of the Cabinet Office, as well as being Accounting Officer. He is also First Parliamentary Counsel, overseeing the Government in Parliament Group, which includes Parliamentary Counsel and the Business Managers in each House. The Group works with teams across government to prepare and deliver the government’s legislative programme.

Name: Melanie Dawes
Job Title: Director General and Head of Economic and Domestic Affairs Secretariat
Job/Team Function: Lead the Secretariat in supporting effective Cabinet Government and ensuring the Prime Minister, Deputy Prime Minister, Minister for Government Policy and the Cabinet Secretary have access to high quality advice and briefing; and support the development, co-ordination and implementation of economic and domestic policy objectives. Provide oversight of the Implementation Group which drives and co-ordinates the domestic policy business of Government.

Name: Chris Last
Job/Team Function: Responsible for delivering an HR service to the Civil Service’s 400,000+ employees and management. To ensure that the HR service is cost-effective and supports the customer-focused delivery of the Civil Service’s activities, and responsible for HR professional development and for introducing Next Generation HR. The introduction of Next Generation HR allows the HR profession to work together across government, ensuring the delivery of HR services more efficiently and effectively. Also responsible for the HR actions in the Civil Service Reform Plan including implementation of the Capabilities Plan; secondments and interchange; common standards of promotion, improving the modern workplace and employment offer; all contributing to delivering an exceptional civil service that is more skilled, less bureaucratic and more unified.
